intro: Rehmannia chingii f. albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered rehmannia, is a variant of the Rehmannia chingii species, which belongs to the family Orobanchaceae. This plant is characterized by its distinctive white flowers, which contrast with its green foliage. It is native to China and is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forests or rocky hillsides. The plant has a short, thick rhizome and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both traditional medicine and horticultural studies.
